books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The story of the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, set in the Jazz Age of the 1920s.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel set in the Deep South and inspired by the author's own experiences, about a young girl named Scout and her father, a lawyer who defends a black man falsely accused of rape.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A novel about a teenage boy named Holden Caulfield, who is expelled from his prep school and spends a few days wandering around New York City, contemplating life and society.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a future totalitarian society, where the government monitors every aspect of citizens' lives and manipulates information to control them.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy novel about a hobbit named Bilbo Baggins who goes on a quest to reclaim a treasure guarded by a dragon, encountering dwarves, elves, and other creatures along the way.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic novel about the Bennet family and their five unmarried daughters, especially the independent and strong-willed Elizabeth, who falls in love with the wealthy Mr. Darcy.

books.title: The Cat in the Hat
books.author: Dr. Seuss
books.description: The Cat in the Hat is a children's book written and illustrated by Theodor Geisel under the pen name Dr. Seuss. It tells the story of a cat's chaotic visit to the home of two children.

books.title: Green Eggs and Ham
books.author: Dr. Seuss
books.description: Green Eggs and Ham is a children's book by Dr. Seuss, first published on August 12, 1960. As of 2019, the book has sold 8 million copies worldwide.

books.title: The Giving Tree
books.author: Shel Silverstein
books.description: The Giving Tree is a children's picture book written and illustrated by Shel Silverstein. First published in 1964 by Harper & Row, it has become one of Silverstein's best-known titles, and has been translated into numerous languages.

books.title: Where the Wild Things Are
books.author: Maurice Sendak
books.description: Where the Wild Things Are is a 1963 children's picture book by American writer and illustrator Maurice Sendak, originally published by Harper & Row.
